Question 40) The Northwest Railway of Brazil, which is beginning to be built only in 1905, was created, unlike the other large railways, to be a penetration railroad, seeking new areas for agriculture and settlement. Until 1890, the coffee was the one who dictated the railroad layout, which were seen only as auxiliary of coffee production.
CARVALHO, D. F. Coffee, railways and population growth: the flowering of the region accessed on: 2 Aug. 2012.
This new orientation given to the rail expansion, during the First Republic, aimed to
A) Articulation of producing poles for export.
B) Infrastructure creation for industrial activity.
C) Integration of small polyculture properties.
D) appreciation of low demographic regions.
E) Promotion of migratory flows from the countryside to the city.
